item.title: 收益超出预期，加航股价大涨 13
item.description: 加拿大航空公司公布的季度收益超出预期，同时宣布了一项新的回购计划，使该航空公司的股价在一年多的时间里得到了最大的提振。【原文：Air Canada posted quarterly earnings that beat estimates while announcing a new buyback program, boosting the airline’s shares the most in more than a year.】

item.title: 电力短缺的赞比亚人从停电中得到一些缓解
item.description: 赞比亚加大了从邻国进口电力的力度，为因厄尔尼诺引发的干旱而导致水力发电厂发电量减少、长期停电的消费者带来了一些安慰。【原文：Zambia ramped up imports of electricity from neighboring countries, bringing some relief to consumers who’ve been subjected to lengthy blackouts as an El Niño-induced drought curbs output from its hydropower plants.】

item.title: 丘吉尔的施维默说，私人信贷收益率将长期保持高位
item.description: 丘吉尔资产管理公司（Churchill Asset Management）副董事长兰迪-施维默（Randy Schwimmer）表示，利率将在更长时间内保持较高水平，从而为私人债务投资者带来收益。【原文：Interest rates will stay higher for longer, providing a yield boost to private debt investors, according to Randy Schwimmer, vice chairman at Churchill Asset Management.】

item.title: 阿波罗竞相推出私人信贷 ETF 将面临美国证券交易委员会审查
item.description: 随着基金经理们推动将私人信贷带入公共市场，一种新型交易所交易基金的投资者将想知道，当市场受到压力时，他们该如何脱身。他们的早期计划并没有解决这些疑问。【原文：As money managers push to bring private credit to public markets, investors in a new breed of exchange-traded fund will want to know how they can get out when markets are stressed. Their early plans aren’t resolving doubts.】

item.title: 印度股市在排灯节期间上涨，华尔街走强
item.description: 受美国股市上涨提振，印度股市在晚间庆祝印度教灯节排灯节的仪式性交易中上涨。【原文：Indian shares rose in a ceremonial late-evening session to mark Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights, boosted by gains in US stocks.】

item.title: 道富要求美国证券交易委员会批准将 ETF 纳入 401(k) 计划
item.description: 州立街全球顾问公司（State Street Global Advisors）正在借鉴先锋集团（Vanguard Group Inc.【原文：State Street Global Advisors is taking a page from Vanguard Group Inc.’s blueprint for multi-share classes to further its bid to insert exchange-traded funds into the American retirement system.】

item.title: 重置浪潮为价值 1 万亿美元的 CLO 市场注入新活力
item.description: 最近几个月，杠杆贷款的最大买家在对其负债进行再融资后，获得了购买更多债务的自由。【原文：The biggest buyers of leveraged loans have gained the freedom to purchase more of the debt in recent months after refinancing their liabilities.】

item.title: 利比亚解决政治危机后欧佩克石油产量回升
item.description: 由于利比亚恢复了在短暂政治危机期间停止的产量，欧佩克的石油产量在上个月有所增加。【原文：OPEC’s oil production rose last month as Libya restored output that was halted during a brief political crisis.】

item.title: 英国将对亚马逊等网络巨头加税以帮助高街发展
item.description: 英国财政部表示，计划提高对亚马逊公司等在线零售商使用的大型配送仓库征收的商业税，此举旨在为降低高街店铺的税费提供资金。【原文：The UK Treasury said it plans to raise business rates levied on large distribution warehouses used by online retailers such as Amazon.com Inc. in a move designed to fund lower tax bills for high street shops.】

item.title: 洛杉矶选民将就创纪录的 90 亿美元学校债券做出决定
item.description: 洛杉矶联合学区是美国第二大学区，该学区要求当地选民下周批准出售 90 亿美元的学校建设债券，以便在入学率下降和城市预算压力下对老化的设施进行现代化改造。【原文：The Los Angeles Unified School District, the second-largest in the US, is asking local voters to approve the sale of $9 billion in school construction bonds next week to modernize its aging facilities amid declining enrollment and city budget pressures.】

item.title: 尼日利亚顶级银行因利率上升带来收益而反弹
item.description: 据经纪人称，在创纪录的高利率提高了利润之后，尼日利亚最大银行的股价将出现反弹。【原文：Nigeria’s biggest banks’ share prices are set to rally after record high interest rates boosted profits, according to brokers.】

item.title: KKR 预计数据中心繁荣将带来 2500 亿美元的年支出
item.description: 据KKR & Co.公司称，支持人工智能和云计算的数据中心需求激增，将使全球在该领域的支出增至每年2500亿美元。【原文：Soaring demand for data centers to support artificial intelligence and cloud-computing will boost global spending in the sector to $250 billion a year, according to KKR & Co.】

item.title: 阿根廷中央银行将基准利率从 40% 下调至 35
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）继续监督这个危机频发的经济体的通胀放缓，阿根廷央行周五下调了基准利率，这是近六个月来的第一次。【原文：Argentina’s central bank lowered its benchmark interest rate Friday for the first time in nearly six months as President Javier Milei continues to oversee a slowdown in inflation in the crisis-prone economy.】

item.title: 分析师认为英国建筑商在经历特鲁斯预算案以来最糟糕的一天后仍有价值
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）分析师表示，他们倾向于买入更多英国住宅建筑商股票，而此前该行业出现了自两年前特鲁斯政府的小型预算案引发暴跌以来的最大跌幅。【原文：Morgan Stanley analysts said they favor buying more UK homebuilder stocks, just after the sector slumped the most since the plunge triggered by the Truss government’s mini-budget two years ago.】

item.title: 抛硬币大选在即，交易员视黄金为稳赚不赔的赌注
item.description: 由于美国大选是现代史上竞争最激烈的选举之一，刺激了避险资产的热潮，黄金一路飙升，许多投资者认为未来黄金还会进一步上涨。【原文：Gold is soaring as one of the most closely contested US elections in modern history spurs a rush to haven assets, and many investors see further gains ahead.】

item.title: 曾是必买之物的 "最受欢迎专辑 "已失去魔力
item.description:
在流媒体时代，合辑已沦为超级粉丝们的新宠

。【原文：

In the streaming era, compilation albums have shrunk to a novelty item for superfans

】

item.title: 铝的致命弱点再次发作
item.description:
冶炼厂所需的氧化铝供应紧张，推动价格创下历史新高，并在啤酒罐和飞机零部件制造商中引发恐慌。【原文：

A supply crunch for the alumina fed into smelters has pushed prices to a record and spread panic among makers of beer cans and airplane parts.

】

item.title: 美国就业数据失真助推美联储减息押注，国债飙升
item.description: 上个月美国经济仅创造了 1.2 万个就业岗位，这增强了人们对美联储下周将降息的预期，美国国债随之反弹。【原文：US government debt rallied after the economy generated just 12,000 jobs last month, bolstering expectations that the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates next week.】

item.title: 吉尔吉斯斯坦考虑最快明年首次出售美元债券
item.description: 吉尔吉斯共和国正在测试投资者对这个中亚国家可能首次出售美元债券的兴趣。【原文：The Kyrgyz Republic is testing investor appetite for a possible first-ever sale of dollar bonds by the central Asian nation.】

item.title: 穆迪、S&P 在对里夫斯预算案的裁决中指出英国面临的挑战
item.description: 评级公司就如何评估本周令金融市场不安的工党新预算案做出了裁决。【原文：Ratings firms delivered their verdict on how they’re assessing the new Labour Party budget, which unnerved financial markets this week.】

item.title: 加拿大帝国商业银行聘用瑞穗的 Rob Cicchetti 推动美国资本市场发展
item.description: 加拿大帝国商业银行聘请了包括瑞穗证券资深人士 Rob Cicchetti 在内的三位银行家，以建立其美国资产支持证券业务。【原文：Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce hired three bankers, including Mizuho Securities veteran Rob Cicchetti, to build out its US asset-backed securities business.】

item.title: 私人借贷需求激增，Ares 增加现金储备
item.description: Ares Management Corp. 第三季度管理的资产增至 4640 亿美元，同比增长 17%，主要得益于对美国直接借贷基金的兴趣和近期的私募股权收购。【原文：Ares Management Corp. grew its assets under management to $464 billion in the third quarter, up 17% from a year prior, driven by interest in its US direct lending funds and recent private equity acquisitions.】

item.title: 淡马锡和共和国支持的区块链基金有望募集 1 亿美元资金
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，淡马锡控股私人有限公司（Temasek Holdings Pte）支持的区块链风险投资公司Superscrypt计划为其第二支投资基金筹集最多1亿美元资金。【原文：Superscrypt, a blockchain venture capital company backed by Temasek Holdings Pte, plans to raise up to $100 million for its second investment fund, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Vanguard 认为英国央行在英国预算案后维持利率的可能性为 50
item.description: Vanguard 资产管理公司（Vanguard Asset Management Ltd）认为，英国央行下周在评估英国政府首份预算案时维持利率不变的可能性为 50%，这将出乎市场意料。【原文：Vanguard Asset Management Ltd sees a 50% chance that the Bank of England will surprise markets next week by keeping interest rates on hold as it evaluates the UK government’s first budget.】

item.title: 尽管补贴终止，Charter 仍能遏制家庭宽带亏损
item.description: 尽管联邦互联网补贴计划已经结束，但有线电视和互联网巨头 Charter Communications Inc.【原文：Charter Communications Inc., the cable and internet giant, lost fewer broadband subscribers than analysts expected in the third quarter, despite the end of a federal internet subsidy program.】

item.title: 微软加快支出步伐，但人工智能要求更多
item.description: 人工智能热潮正以一些意想不到的方式影响着微软。但首先...【原文：The AI boom is affecting Microsoft in a few unanticipated ways. But first...】

item.title: 大选前关键摇摆州油泵价格暴跌 20
item.description: 在总统竞选即将拉开帷幕的前几天，消费者用来衡量通货膨胀的最重要数据之一--油泵价格在关键的摇摆州出现暴跌。【原文：Days before a neck-and-neck presidential race, pump prices — one of the most salient data points consumers use to gauge inflation — are tumbling in key swing states.】

item.title: JetSMART 增添阿根廷机队，米莱（Milei）开放天空
item.description: 智利 JetSMART 航空公司（JetSMART Airlines SpA）正在增加其在阿根廷的机队数量，因为哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）总统正在寻求放松对航空业的管制，瓦解这家旗舰航空公司在国内市场的主导地位。【原文：Chile’s JetSMART Airlines SpA is increasing its fleet of planes in Argentina as President Javier Milei seeks to deregulate the aviation industry and dismantle the flagship airline’s dominance in the domestic market.】

item.title: 墨西哥金融科技公司 Klar 为 2026 年上市设定了 5 亿美元的收入目标
item.description: 墨西哥金融技术公司 Klar 预计其发展道路将使其能够在 2026 年底寻求首次公开募股。【原文：Mexican financial technology firm Klar is expecting its growth path to allow it to seek an initial public offering at the end of 2026.】

item.title: 科技巨头今年将斥资 2000 亿美元追逐人工智能
item.description: 三个月前，华尔街惩罚了全球最大的科技公司，因为它们花费巨资开发人工智能，但结果却无法证明成本的合理性。【原文：Three months ago, Wall Street punished the world’s largest technology firms for spending enormous amounts to develop artificial intelligence, only to deliver results that failed to justify the costs.】
